posts.title: Mercury
posts.body:
Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun. Its orbit around the Sun takes 87.97 Earth days, the shortest of all the Sun's planets. Wikipedia
View on Maps: google.com/maps/space/mercury
Distance from Sun: 58 million km
Radius: 2,439.7 km
Surface area: 74.8 million km²
Mass: 3.285 × 10^23 kg (0.055 M⊕)
Coordinates: RA 12h 56m 54s | Dec -4° 0′ 10″
Apparent magnitude (V): 0.23
posts.author: Me Atme

posts.title: Venus
posts.body:
Venus is the second planet from the Sun. It is sometimes called Earth's "sister" or "twin" planet as it is almost as large and has a similar composition. Venus, like Mercury, appears in Earth's sky never far from the Sun, either as morning star or evening star with a synodic period of 1.6 years. Wikipedia
View on Maps: google.com/maps/space/venus
Distance from Sun: 108.2 million km
Radius: 6,051.8 km
Surface area: 460.2 million km²
Density: 5.24 g/cm³
Mass: 4.867 × 10^24 kg (0.815 M⊕)
Length of day: 116d 18h 0m
posts.author: Me Atme

posts.title: Earth
posts.body:
Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life. While large volumes of water can be found throughout the Solar System, only Earth sustains liquid surface water. About 71% of Earth's surface is made up of the ocean, dwarfing Earth's polar ice, lakes, and rivers. Wikipedia
Age: 4.543 billion years
Distance from Sun: 149.6 million km
Radius: 6,371 km
Mass: 5.972 × 10^24 kg
Surface area: 510.1 million km²
Land area: 148.9 million km²
Population: 7.753 billion (2020) World Bank
posts.author: Me Atme

posts.title: Mars
posts.body:
Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and the second-smallest planet in the Solar System, being larger than only Mercury. In the English language, Mars is named for the Roman god of war. Wikipedia
View on Maps: google.com/maps/space/mars
Distance from Sun: 227.9 million km
Radius: 3,389.5 km
Surface area: 144.8 million km²
Mass: 6.39 × 10^23 kg (0.107 M⊕)
Density: 3.93 g/cm³
Moons: Phobos, Deimos
posts.author: Me Atme
